etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From French purpurogalline from purpur- (in purpurine) + -ogall- + -ine

definitions: An orange-red crystalline dye, originally prepared by mild oxidation of pyrogallol and later found to occur in some oak galls.

notes.text: Purpurogallin is a tetrahydric phenol with fused tropolone and trihydroxybenzene rings; C₁₁H₈O₅.
